articles.title: Chicago couple treated for new virus released from isolation
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Chicago woman and her husband, who became the United States' first person-to-person transmission of the new virus from China, have been released from home isolation, health officials said Saturday.
articles.content:
CHICAGO (AP) A Chicago woman and her husband, who became the United States' first person-to-person transmission of the new virus from China, have been released from home isolation, health officials said Saturday.

articles.title: Drivers still seeing lower prices at the pump
articles.description: TRENTON, N.J. (AP) — Drivers in New Jersey and around the nation are again seeing lower prices at the pump amid continued low oil prices, a slight increase in East Coast inventories and demand at typical lower wintertime levels.
articles.content:

articles.title: France announces 1st death in Europe of virus patient
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — The French health minister has announced the first coronavirus death in Europe.
articles.content:
PARIS (AP) The French health minister has announced the first coronavirus death in Europe.
French Health Minister Agnes Buzyn says Saturday that "I was informed last night of the death of an 80-year-old patient who had been hospitalized ... since Jan. 25."

articles.title: US defense chief slams China as rising threat to world order

articles.title: Amid virus outbreak, concerns about a hockey stick shortage

articles.title: China gymnastics team pulls out of WCup due to travel ban
articles.description: MELBOURNE, Australia (AP) — The Chinese gymnastics team entered into next week's World Cup in Melbourne has withdrawn from the event due to Australian government travel restrictions put in place to limit the coronavirus outbreak, organizers said on Saturday.

articles.title: New virus has infected more than 67,000 people globally
